p: A comparison of the kinetic data of H 2O 2 metabolism between thiol targets and GSH has been performed in mammalian cells. The decomposition of H 2O 2 by GSH is dependent on the concentration of H 2O 2, and GSH has a lower affinity for H 2O 2 than do GPx and Prdx. Therefore, both GPx and Prdx are the main metabolic pathways for H 2O 2 at low concentration, whereas GSH would have a prominent function at higher concentrations of H 2O 2 [ 27]. A kinetical analysis has shown that both Prdx2 and GPx1 are strong sensors of H 2O 2 [ 27].
